Name: Pork Sinigang
Description: A classic Filipino sour soup made with pork, tamarind, and vegetables.
Instruction: Boil pork until tender, add tamarind mix and vegetables, then simmer until fully cooked.

Name: Adobo
Description: A savory Filipino dish made by stewing meat in soy sauce, vinegar, and spices.
Instruction: Marinate meat in soy sauce and vinegar, then cook with garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns.

Name: Chicken Tinola
Description: A Filipino chicken soup with green papaya and ginger.
Instruction: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger. Add chicken and water. Simmer and add papaya and chili leaves.

Name: Lechon Kawali
Description: Crispy deep-fried pork belly served with dipping sauce.
Instruction: Boil pork belly until tender, then deep fry until golden and crispy. Serve with dipping sauce.

Name: Halo-Halo
Description: A popular Filipino dessert with mixed sweetened fruits, shaved ice, and milk.
Instruction: Layer sweetened fruits, beans, and jelly in a glass. Add shaved ice and milk. Top with ube and leche flan.

Name: Kare-Kare
Description: A Filipino peanut stew with oxtail, tripe, and vegetables.
Instruction: Cook oxtail and tripe until tender. Add peanut butter sauce and vegetables. Serve with shrimp paste.

Name: Pancit Canton
Description: A Filipino stir-fried noodle dish with vegetables and meat or seafood.
Instruction: Sauté garlic and onion. Add meat or seafood, then vegetables. Stir fry with noodles and soy sauce.
